{"step_by_step_thinking": "In the management of maternal-neonatal emergencies (Mmn), the supine position is avoided to prevent aortocaval compression, which can compromise blood flow to the fetus. Oxygen inhalation is often used to increase oxygen supply to the fetus. Intravenous fluids are administered to maintain maternal hydration and blood volume. Subcutaneous terbutaline, a tocolytic, is not typically used in this scenario as it is used to inhibit uterine contractions, which is not the goal when the patient is already in labor and being shifted for surgery.", "answer_choice": "D. Subcutaneous terbutaline"}
